intro: Eleocharis wichurae var. teres, commonly known as the dwarf spike-rush, is a flowering plant in the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, grass-like appearance with short, cylindrical spikelets. Native to wetland environments, it thrives in shallow water or moist soils. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically wind-pollinated. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support aquatic ecosystems.
